fr.sii.ogham.spring.template.thymeleaf

Interface ThymeleafWebContextProvider

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    SpringWebContextProvider, WebExpressionContextProvider

    public interface ThymeleafWebContextProvider
    Generate an instance of a Thymeleaf IContext that is suitable in a Web application. The generated context is then used to provide access to Spring extensions from templates such as #mvc.url, @{/path/to/controller} and any other Spring extension.
    Author:
    Aur√©lien Baudet

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.thymeleaf.context.IContext getWebContext(Context context, org.thymeleaf.context.IContext base, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response, javax.servlet.ServletContext servletContext, org.springframework.context.ApplicationContext applicationContext, Map<String,Object> springModel)
      Generates the suitable context for a Web application.

    • Method Detail

      • getWebContext

        org.thymeleaf.context.IContext getWebContext(Context context,
                                             org.thymeleaf.context.IContext base,
                                             javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                             javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response,
                                             javax.servlet.ServletContext servletContext,
                                             org.springframework.context.ApplicationContext applicationContext,
                                             Map<String,Object> springModel)
        Generates the suitable context for a Web application.
        Parameters:
        context - Ogham original context that may be used to retrieve extra information
        base - Thymeleaf context that has been converted from Ogham original context. It contains the base variables extracted from Ogham context.
        request - the current HTTP request
        response - the current HTTP response
        servletContext - the servlet execution context
        applicationContext - the application context
        springModel - the model that contains both variables extracted from Ogham context and Spring variables (static variables, evaluation context, ...)
        Returns:
        the suitable context for a Web application to provide access to Spring extensions
